summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 9, 2019. It includes inmate count sheets, rosters, and out-count forms, which are standard prison operational records for tracking inmate location and status. The significance lies in the date, as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at this facility.

persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 53358-054 on an out-count form and inmate roster. Appears in multiple administrative lists.

events.title: Prison Administrative Counts
events.description: Routine inmate counts and status checks were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, as documented by various count sheets, rosters, and out-count forms.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The federal detention facility in Manhattan where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated and where these administrative records were generated.

keyFacts: The documents are Bureau of Prisons administrative records dated August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
Jeffrey Epstein is listed as inmate 76318-054 on an inmate roster, with an 'ATTY' (attorney visit) assignment and housed in unit '9 South'.
The records show standard prison operations including inmate counts, rosters, and out-counts, which are procedures for tracking inmate location and status.
Multiple other inmates are listed in the rosters, indicating the general prison population at MCC New York on that date.
The forms include 'SUICIDE OR' (Suicide Observation Room) designations for some inmates, indicating special monitoring protocols were in place.
